question-text: Write TRUE or FALSE for each of the following statements.

set1.question-item-text: The elements with low electron affinity easily gain electrons, resulting in the formation of anions.
The heat absorbed or released in a process occurring at constant pressure is called the enthapy change.
White phosphorus bursts into flames when exposed to air.
A catalyst does not effect the equilibrium concentrations, and there is no change in equilibrium.
Bronsted-Lowry acid is a proton donor.
Many transition elements and their compounds act as good catalysts for specific reactions.
Cadmium in the environment is not also toxic to plants, animals, and microorganisms.
Green chemistry is the design of chemical products and processes that reduce or eliminate the use or generation of hazardous substances.
The IUPAC name of HCOOH is ethanoic acid.
Plastics that are thrown into the sea endanger marine animals.

set2.question-item-text: Buffers are very important to chemical and biological systems.
The reaction is completely stopped at equilibrium.
London dispersion forces are the strongest intermolecular forces.
The transition elements usually form coloured compounds and ions.
The main component of nail polish remover is carboxylic acid.
Most of the Earthâ€™s carbon is stored in rocks and sediments.
Reaction particles moving in random directions possess kinetic energy.
In a spontaneous reaction, physical or chemical change occurs with the addition of energy.
Each functional group has characteristic absorption range of wavenumbers.
Although the 4s orbital is the outermost orbital, it is slightly higher in energy than the 3d orbitals.

set3.question-item-text: Two electrons with the same spin can occupy the same orbital.
Enthalpy changes are due to the breaking and forming of bonds.
Transition state is a highly energetic state that would be highly unstable
If a reversible reaction is in a closed system, the system can reach a state called a dynamic equilibrium.
The dissociation constant of a weaker acid is greater than that of a stronger acid.
In general, transition metals do not corrode readily in the solution.
Respiration is the process of gas exchange between the atmosphere and living organisms.
Electrons in the infrared radiation region can cause bond vibrations in molecules.
Sillicon(III) oxide is an example of a giant covalent molucule.
An ether is an organic compound with an O atom bonded to two alkyl groups.

set4.question-item-text: The formation of products is favoured by high temperature in an exothermic reaction.
Many inorganic substances and millions of organic compounds have covalent bonding.
Ethanoic acid is manufactured by the fermentation of ethanol.
A rate is always expressed as a positive quantity.
NH<sub>3<sub> molecule behaves as a Lewis acid which donates an electron pair.
Transition elements are significantly more reactive than Group I metals.
Degradation of pesticides can occur before application on the farm.
Large amount of background radiation comes from man-made sources.
Hydrogen bond is a special type of dipole-dipole interaction that occurs between nonpolar molecules.
The reaction between magnesium and oxygen is a non-spontaneous reaction.
